intro: Erythraea sylvatica, commonly known as the redwood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with reddish veins. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in its native habitat.
